content.title: SERB - POWER Research Grants
content.details: The “SERB - POWER Research Grants” is a program category under the SERB-POWER (Promoting Opportunities For Women in Exploratory Research) Program, launched by the Science and Engineering Research Board (SERB), Ministry of Science & Technology, Government of India. SERB - POWER program is formulated to mitigate gender disparity in science and engineering research funding in various S&T programs in Indian academic institutions and R&D Laboratories. The aim of the ‘SERB - POWER Research Grants’ is to encourage emerging and eminent women researchers for an individual-centric and competitive mode of research funding to undertake R&D activities in frontier areas of science and engineering.
benefits: Level I: The scale of funding up to ₹60 lakhs for three years.
Level II: The scale of funding up to ₹30 lakhs for three years.
Funding for equipment, manpower, consumables, travel, and contingency.
eligibility: Must hold a regular academic/research position in a recognized institution.
Applicants from IITs, IISERs, IISc, NITs, Central Universities, and National Labs are considered under Level I.
Applicants from State Universities/Colleges and Private Academic Institutions should apply under Level II.
Mandatory requirement for female CO-PI from the same institute.
PIs who have already got a POWER Grant cannot apply again.
JC Bose fellows and PIs who have completed two CRG are not allowed to apply.
The number of CO-PIs should not exceed two per project.
exclusions: Women Scientists cannot hold POWER Fellowship and POWER Grant at the same time.
content.application_process: Online application process through the SERB website.

faqs.question: What is the maximum amount of the grant the Board will fund?
faqs.answer: POWER Grants will empower women researchers by funding them under Level I: up to 60 Lakhs for three years and Level II: up to 30 Lakhs for three years.

faqs.question: Does the Board have any priority areas for funding under SERB- POWER research grant?
faqs.answer: No, the Board funds all areas of Science and Engineering without discriminating between disciplines.

faqs.question: Are Co-Investigators allowed in SERB- POWER research grant project?
faqs.answer: Yes, only female Co-Investigator(s) are allowed.
